name: Mondrian South Beach Hotel

reviews.text: This is very much a place geared up for a party. I don't think I've ever before been presented with a breakfast menu, where the first page is cocktails! The decor and theme is minimalist white with quirky touches. I had a lovely large room, with a studio design and small kitchenette. It was a little too bare for my taste and things had been done a bit on the cheap. However, it suits the Miami style and clutter does not go well in the heat. The staff are friendly and helpful. Public areas all centre around the pool and outdoor bar - which have the wow factor and get a great sunset. The restaurant is fine - but not busy and the food was pretty average (I had some very dry chicken). Some people may be put off by the location, as it is not on the beach and there is not much on the doorstep. Still, the price is reasonable and it's a nice addition to the party theme of Miami.
reviews.title: Chic, White Party Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My favorite part of this hotel is the POOL. It's absolutely beautiful and I love that it overlooks the bay. Gorgeous. The hotel's design itself is really unique. Very modern and artsy. The doll's image everywhere is a bit freaky though. Also took me awhile to figure out how the shower worked but I really liked the overhead spray. Only problem was the length of time it took for them to bring our bags up when we checked it and that there's no ATM in the hotel. It's ok though :) This was part of my boyfriend's surprise bday trip and he LOVED the hotel! He's totally metro so it was perfect for him. It's about a mile from the beach which is a little far if you don't like to walk...but still in an easy cab distance to restaurants and stores.
reviews.title: GORGEOUS pool, interesting design, and beautiful bay view.

reviews.text: There were several people who made my boyfriend and my stay at Mondrian an excellent experience. The bar at the pool had (3) people staffing it on July 3, 2011 (two males and one female) and they were AMAZING. They were friendly, made us great drinks, and I cannot commend them enough for entertaining us. Also, the restaurant bar that same night had a male bartender and an intern working at the time and they were great at cheering me up + recommending excellent food for me. Please make sure they get my thank you and if possible, give them a raise or something! Everyone was amazing :)
reviews.title: If you have the money to spend..look no further!

reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful, perfectly Miami sheek, rooms are sexy, lounge/club in lobby, great for celeb watching and above all and totally shocking-They put effort in their SERVICE! This is a novelty for Miami Beach hotels. We were always greeted with smiles and hellos from the front counter, to the restaurants, to the concierge even from the maintanance ppl in the elevators. This may be a norm at family hotels but anyone who knows South Beach will be raising eyebrows.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings....a party hotel, nice design, not great value and not much around the hotel.

reviews.text: kudos to Mondrian Management Btw..its not necessarily a Morgans group thing...The Shoreclub could step it up a notch.

reviews.text: We stayed there with my wife for 7 days, one bedroom suite, really nice design porcelaine wall in the kitchen, quirky wall mirrors, chandelier in the shower. Stayed in delano and setai a few years ago and the mondrian is very very similar to the Delano. Same party vibe, the Mondrian has a much better pool area - truly one of the best i have seen, amazing design, great drinks, superb view and cool crowd, the same kind of 50-50 service (some guys are perfect others believe they are moviestars stuck in a waiter role), but has no beach access.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros. Very clean and spacious and if you are looking for quiet this is the place for you. Garage parking ($15/24 hours), Starbucks and The Fresh Market are all on the corner. We parked our car and either walked or biked around town. A cab to Ocean Dr. costs about $6 and you can then walk to most clubs and restaurants. We did not eat at the Mondrian nor did we use the spa.
reviews.title: Pros and cons...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons. They only have valet and it costs $37/day so beware! The sun rises on the rooms with street view and your room will be very bright even with the backed curtain. The pool closes at sunset but I believe this is a city ordinance for all hotels. The staff seemed perterbed that our bikes were in the lobby and we were asked to move them, we brought drinks down to the pool (you must use their cups) and you cannot touch the dining room furniture when the dining room is closed.
reviews.title: Completely Personable Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an incredible vacation! I went to vacation in May 2011 at the Mondrian, Miami. I had been to the Mondrian in Hollywood and was excited in anticipation to have a similar experience in Miami, South Beach. My experience in South Beach was so much more incredible. Upon arriving to the hotel, I was met by a wonderful staff that seemed authentic in their greeting. The rooms are unique with functional style, and clean, clean, clean. I loved the kitchen with the perfect feel of home. I knew I could make this my home away from home for the next week in Miami. Although Mondrian is on the western edge of south beach, I much prefer this over to the more popular eastern side of south beach. For one, the view of the city is amazing, which only becomes more spectacular at night. The eastern edge has the ocean view, but that's it, and at night there is no interesting skyline, and no fabulous sunset. Let me tell you about the best part, the service is amazing. Coming from a small city in northern California, I felt like a celebrity at the Mondrian, Miami. Everyone was personable! I felt like Norm from the TV series "Cheers". Everybody knew my name. Was this normal for a hotel experience? I don't know, but you better believe, I coming back here, over and over again. This has become my number one vacation spot. Mondrian, Miami is highly recommended in my book.
reviews.title: Relaxing and low key

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel with a great staff! I have stayed here two times and love it, it is very calm (except Sunday afternoon/evening) compared to Collins Avenue but the facilities are just as good and the rooms are huge.
reviews.title: Luxurious Paradise

reviews.text: It is an easy walk to everything (10-15 minutes). If you are not familiar with South Beach you may feel a little lost on foot. Make sure to eat at Asia de Cuba
reviews.title: BYOB

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a former resident of Miami now living in Atlanta, I frequently travel back and forth to meet with clients, visit friends or just for a weekend getaway. In the past, I've stayed at another hotel which has a relationship with my firm. However, I don't think I will ever stray from the Mondrian. The location is absolutely perfect. You're not privy to the unsavory parts of the beach but you're also walking distance or a $5 cab drive to Lincoln Road and Ocean Drive. You also have easy interstate access so you can get to Brickell, downtown, the Design District or Coral Gables relatively easily. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the accomodating and friendly staff. David Arth at the pool was very attentive to our needs both at the pool and our overall stay in general. Ditto Nocle Ormeno at the front desk.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend

reviews.text: This is hands down one of the best experiences my wife and I have had in Miami. From start to finish this large hotel had a boutique atmosphere, personalized service, and an extremely attentive staff! The hotel was exceptionally clean, and the outside area was roomy, had plenty of staff to help with towels and lounge chairs, likewise, the view of the islands was excellent! Specifically I would like to call attention to Olya the bartender outside who knew her drinks inside and out. We had an opportunity to sample some of the new creations the Mondrian had to offer, as well as some classics. The staff at the front desk was just as helpful. Likewise, I don't believe I've ever experienced a more prompt valet service. Over all the hotel's contemporary decor did not isolate you or feel cold, it felt just right and very inviting. We cannot wait to stay at this hotel on our next trip. I strongly recommend the Mondrian as a very necessary part of anyone's Miami experience.
reviews.title: Phenomenal Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall – I would definitely return and recommend, but not for everyone. We are locals to South Florida and enjoy the short drive into Miami for long weekends. I didn’t want the loud and crowded party scene this weekend, instead opting for a relaxed, low key but active weekend. Unless there is a special event or party planned, then Mondrian is usually not a loud, party, crowded and clubby hotel like some of the other bigger places.
reviews.title: Relaxing and trendy Hotel - Good Location - Well Appointed Rooms

reviews.text: HOTEL – Décor is obviously unique, modern, trendy and in my opinion charming. Service was fantastic from the valet, check in, fast room service, lobby and pool bar, etc. The hotel was busy, but not super crowded, which is what we were looking for. Has a smaller boutique hotel feel, not a huge resort. The lobby bar area was comfortable, but not a huge party scene. Again, this is what we wanted. Friday was quiet, and Saturday was a little more lively, but again, if you want a very lively, club-like scene or place to dance, then you’ll want to explore elsewhere at night.
reviews.title: What a trendy place,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: VALET - $$$$$ Like all of the Miami Beach hotels, Valet is robbery at $37 a day. Not including tip. Trust me with this - If you don’t plan on leaving the Miami Beach area (i.e drive up to Fort Lauderdale, Palm Beach or the Everglades, etc) then don’t bother renting a car at the airport!! Take a taxi to the hotel and out during the day/night. You’ll spend a fortune on valets everywhere you go or drive yourself nuts looking for parking.

reviews.text: GYM - The gym is modern with a decent selection of cardio and weight equipment. Can’t beat the view of the bay and skyline from the treadmills. I didn’t visit the Spa, but have heard numerous wonderful reviews.

reviews.text: One of the features that makes this hotel appealing is it's West Bay location on West Avenue--opposite of the actual South Beach and Collins Avenue. Yes, you are removed from South Beach's most popular and vibrant spot BUT you are also removed from the hustle and bustle of that area too--which can be a tad overwhelming to some! The Mondrian offers a more laid back and tranquil atmosphere without losing the energy and vibrancy that IS Miami and South Beach. Plus, you are a hop and a skip from ANYWHERE on South Beach and its great hotels, nightlife, clubs and restaurants. There is PLENTY to offer at this hotel: Great pool with excellent bar, food, poolside service, plus GORGEOUS sunsets (since the pool is facing directly west towards downtown Miami and the bay) and excellent "playlist" pumped over the state-of-the-art sound system!
reviews.title: Excellent - Hip Miami with excellent service and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For foodies and people that LOVE a hip, jet-setter, world-class restaurant, try the always solid and always tasty Asia De Cuba! This original New York centerpiece restaurant gets a decidedly "Latino Miami style" flair to it's dishes. Whether you're enjoying fabulous libations like the the Asian Pear Martini or Lychee Saketini signature cocktails, starting with the light and airy Tunapica or the classic Calamari Salad "Asia De Cuba" or enjoying sumptuous entrees like the Sweet Soy Wild Salmon or the Cuban BBQ Chicken you can count on "eyes-rolling-in-the-back-of-your-head" good! If you're poolside, try the amazing Grilled Ahi Tuna Burger with Mojito Fries or the Maine Lobster Quesadillas. And if you ask, you may even get the bartender to whip up a Mixed Berry Mojito--which is NOT in the menu! Our bartender, Blaine always accommodated us with a wink and a smile and we were hooked on them!
reviews.title: Fantastic - will only stay here in future!

aka: Mondrian South Beach Hotel Miami Beach
description: Located on newly-fashionable West Avenue, Mondrian is a quiet enclave just minutes from the bustling center of South Beach, offering spectacular views of the Atlantic Ocean, Biscayne Bay and downtown Miami. The visionary style of designer Marcel Wanders is apparent from the moment you pull into the porte-cochere: guests walk through a grand entryway appointed with custom-designed furniture, lighting and accent pieces, evoking Wanders' design homage of "Sleeping Beauty's Castle." Upon entering the soaring lobby, the floor-to-ceiling windows offer stunning views of Biscayne Bay. Immediately the eye is drawn to the masterpiece of the room–an iconic, signature "floating staircase." Black and gold patterned furnishings and oversized brass bell shaped lights add a touch of whimsy and welcome guests to sit and socialize or enjoy the view.
